puzzles.title: pattern words
puzzles.header: Words that have 2 or more of the same letter are called 'pattern words'. For example 'food', 'glug', 'salad'. These words are easy to spot and sometimes easy to guess! Can you name the capital city in Europe
puzzles.footer: I'll give you a hint: The River Thames.

puzzles.title: short words
puzzles.header: There aren't many 2 and 3 letter words in English. Two letter words include 'it', 'an', 'on', 'in', 'of', 'he'. Three letters could be 'the', 'and', 'was', 'her', 'him', 'but' etc. Can you figure this out? It's the famous opening line from a book by Charles Dickens
puzzles.plaintext: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.
puzzles.footer: Hint: A Tale of Two Cities.

puzzles.title: letter counts ETAONRHS
puzzles.header:
The eight most common letters in English are usually ETAONRHS, in that order. Use the character count at the bottom of the screen to help you guess which ciphertext letter probably represents 'e' and so on. Don't forget to look for short words like 'the' and 'and'.
